trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Many app developers naturally create their apps thinking only of their own language and culture.
trans-unit.target: Many app developers naturally create their apps thinking only of their own language and culture.

trans-unit.source: But when the app begins to grow into other markets, adapting the app for new languages and regions can be difficult in unexpected ways.
trans-unit.target: But when the app begins to grow into other markets, adapting the app for new languages and regions can be difficult in unexpected ways.

trans-unit.source: For example, dates, times, numbers, calendars, currency, telephone numbers, units of measurement, and paper sizes are all items that can be displayed differently in different cultures or languages.
trans-unit.target: For example, dates, times, numbers, calendars, currency, telephone numbers, units of measurement, and paper sizes are all items that can be displayed differently in different cultures or languages.

trans-unit.source: The process of adapting to new markets can be simplified by taking a few things into account as you develop your app.
trans-unit.target: The process of adapting to new markets can be simplified by taking a few things into account as you develop your app.

trans-unit.source: Format dates and times appropriately.
trans-unit.target: Format dates and times appropriately.

trans-unit.source: There are many different ways to properly display dates and times.
trans-unit.target: There are many different ways to properly display dates and times.

trans-unit.source: Different regions and cultures use different conventions for the order of day and month in the date, for the separation of hours and minutes in the time, and even for what punctuation is used as a separator.
trans-unit.target: Different regions and cultures use different conventions for the order of day and month in the date, for the separation of hours and minutes in the time, and even for what punctuation is used as a separator.

trans-unit.source: In addition, dates may be displayed in various long formats ("Wednesday, March 28, 2012") or short formats ("3/28/12"), which can vary across cultures.
trans-unit.target: In addition, dates may be displayed in various long formats ("Wednesday, March 28, 2012") or short formats ("3/28/12"), which can vary across cultures.

trans-unit.source: And of course, the names and abbreviations for the days of the week and months of the year differ for every language.
trans-unit.target: And of course, the names and abbreviations for the days of the week and months of the year differ for every language.

trans-unit.source: If you need to allow users to choose a date or select a time, use the standard [date and time picker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465466) controls.
trans-unit.target: If you need to allow users to choose a date or select a time, use the standard [date and time picker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465466) controls.

trans-unit.source: These will automatically use the date and time formats for the user's preferred language and region.
trans-unit.target: These will automatically use the date and time formats for the user's preferred language and region.

trans-unit.source: If you need to display dates or times yourself, use [**Date/Time**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206859) and [**Number**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226136) formatters to automatically display the user's preferred format for dates, times and numbers.
trans-unit.target: If you need to display dates or times yourself, use [**Date/Time**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206859) and [**Number**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226136) formatters to automatically display the user's preferred format for dates, times and numbers.

trans-unit.source: Format numbers and currencies appropriately.
trans-unit.target: Format numbers and currencies appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Different cultures format numbers differently.
trans-unit.target: Different cultures format numbers differently.

trans-unit.source: Format differences may include how many decimal digits to display, what characters to use as decimal separators, and what currency symbol to use.
trans-unit.target: Format differences may include how many decimal digits to display, what characters to use as decimal separators, and what currency symbol to use.

trans-unit.source: Use [**NumberFormatting**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226136) to display decimal, percent, or permille numbers, and currencies.
trans-unit.target: Use [**NumberFormatting**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226136) to display decimal, percent, or permille numbers, and currencies.

trans-unit.source: In most cases you simply display numbers or currencies according to the user's current preferences.
trans-unit.target: In most cases you simply display numbers or currencies according to the user's current preferences.

trans-unit.source: But you may also use the formatters to display a currency for a particular region or format.
trans-unit.target: But you may also use the formatters to display a currency for a particular region or format.

trans-unit.source: Use a culturally appropriate calendar.
trans-unit.target: Use a culturally appropriate calendar.

trans-unit.source: The calendar differs across regions and languages.
trans-unit.target: The calendar differs across regions and languages.

trans-unit.source: The Gregorian calendar is not the default for every region.
trans-unit.target: The Gregorian calendar is not the default for every region.

trans-unit.source: Users in some regions may choose alternate calendars, such as the Japanese era calendar or Arabic lunar calendars.
trans-unit.target: Users in some regions may choose alternate calendars, such as the Japanese era calendar or Arabic lunar calendars.

trans-unit.source: Dates and times on the calendar are also sensitive to different time zones and daylight saving time.
trans-unit.target: Dates and times on the calendar are also sensitive to different time zones and daylight saving time.

trans-unit.source: Use the standard [date and time picker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465466) controls to allow users to choose a date, to ensure that the preferred calendar format is used.
trans-unit.target: Use the standard [date and time picker](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465466) controls to allow users to choose a date, to ensure that the preferred calendar format is used.

trans-unit.source: For more complex scenarios, where working directly with operations on calendar dates may be required, Windows.Globalization provides a [**Calendar**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206724) class that gives an appropriate calendar representation for the given culture, region, and calendar type.
trans-unit.target: For more complex scenarios, where working directly with operations on calendar dates may be required, Windows.Globalization provides a [**Calendar**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206724) class that gives an appropriate calendar representation for the given culture, region, and calendar type.

trans-unit.source: Respect the user's Language and Cultural Preferences.
trans-unit.target: Respect the user's Language and Cultural Preferences.

trans-unit.source: For scenarios where you provide different functionality based on the user's language, region, or cultural preferences, Windows gives you a way to access those preferences, through [**Windows.System.UserProfile.GlobalizationPreferences**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241825).
trans-unit.target: For scenarios where you provide different functionality based on the user's language, region, or cultural preferences, Windows gives you a way to access those preferences, through [**Windows.System.UserProfile.GlobalizationPreferences**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241825).

trans-unit.source: When needed, use the **GlobalizationPreferences** class to get the value of the user's current geographic region, preferred languages, preferred currencies, and so on.
trans-unit.target: When needed, use the **GlobalizationPreferences** class to get the value of the user's current geographic region, preferred languages, preferred currencies, and so on.
